description:
I can't believe I've never noticed this cafe while shopping and wandering around Hayes Valley! I love the neighborhood and this strip of Octavia is particularly serene and cozy.

The cafe is fairly small with tables squeezed in snuggly around the corners of the cafe, leaving the center open as a walkway around the cafe. The restroom was surprisingly clean and not too compact, considering the total space of the cafe.

I love the giant open window at the front of the cafe, although the day I went was a bit too cold for me to enjoy it being opened. I ordered a latte with almond milk, which was neither bad or amazing, though a bit on the smaller size. The barista who took my order was courteous, and I'm glad that they accept Apple Pay here, as I forgot my wallet.

Would definitely come back to this little nook to do some work over the weekends, I just love the Hayes Valley neighborhood vibes that this cafe perfectly emulates (it's quite romantic)!
author: Victoria W.

description: The barista here is extremely rude and short. I have therapist i can recommend if he needs help? Also the coffee he made tastes like shit.
author: Charlotte V.

description:
Cafe La Vie is the definition of cozy little nook.

Walked here for a light breakfast after yoga. My friend and I just wanted a hot drink (we both got the spicy chai's) and I ordered a veggie bagel combo.

There is zero space inside, so if you're in a large group, search for a meeting point outside the cafe...but send one person in to order everything. We sat outside in the public area under a tree, but we saw customers with their dogs sitting at provided small cafe tables or other public seating too. It's a great spot for a lazy and easy-going Sunday morning.

It's basically a two-person show the day we went, so be patient if you're ordering a lot of stuff. Props to the two baristas/cashier's running around the place taking orders and making the meals/drinks. Service won't be with a smile or overtly friendly, but I'm sure it's because there's just so much to do between them to...it was just average. My spicy chai was flavorful, but wasn't hot enough and a little on the sweet side. I wish the spicy chai was actually...spicy. The veggie bagel (I chose everything bagel) combo was delicious with the fresh hummus and veggies in it--I was definitely full and felt so refreshed.

The good thing is the cost of everything. My drink and filling breakfast was just under $10! I miss the authenticity of cafe meals just being under the "teens" of pricing. Props to Cafe La Vie for keeping to it. Their menu is extensive with the bagel and croissant options--with everything looking so tasty and fresh. Their pastry box is full of other delectable goods sweet and savory, so check it out.

Will be back next time I'm in Hayes. This is a no frills joint that plays deliciously jazzy music. I dig it.
author: Jodi H.

description: Friendly staff, fast and delicious food and an affordable little gem in the heart of Hayes Valley. Creative decoration.
author: Monique F.

description:
From out of town visiting my brother in law and I have to say this neighborhood is a great place to visit but is the etmpimomy of gentrification. 
Got my coffees and 4 bagels as ordered, and I did it without feeling it necessary to get "a smile" from the "young Asian woman" like some of these other posts or get small talk, "Customer Service", with anyone working there.  It's a genuine OG neighborhood coffee house that are now disappearing because of also these other so-called independent 5 dollar coffees coffee companies. It's so far the least pretentious of all of the coffee shops I have checked out here so far, good coffee and bagels, a stylist place to work/chill out... and I highly recommend it.
author: Subir D.

description:
This is my favorite coffee place in Hayes Valley by far and now the only one I go to.

Cozy, warm, smells AMAZING all the time, great spicy chai, great pastries, nice little nooks for working, reading or catching up with a friend, and just enough off the Hayes drag that you get a little more quiet in the mornings.
author: Mike V.

description: I love Cafe La Vie!  I visit Hayes Valley every three or four months and Cafe La Vie is my where I go every morning for my coffee.  Highly recommend!
author: Laurie B.

description: Good spot, though their wifi is intercepting ssl so many website don't load. It looks like their Cisco Umbrella is misconfigured.
author: Brendon B.

description:
The person taking my order today- young Asian woman- was not polite or friendly. Even when I greeted her with a good morning and a thank you- it was not reciprocated. No eye contact, nada. The bagel sandwiches are pretty good and priced well so I come here a lot, BUT customer service is very important to maintain business so that regulars like me continue to feel welcomed. 

There is a new bagel shop across the street -Wise Brothers- so now is not the time to down grade your customer service when competition is right there. Hopefully this woman usually provides better customer service.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Coffee here is amazing. Line can be long but the service is super quick! The lox bagels is amazing and super quick! There is a shorter girl with dark hair who works there and she is the best. So quick it is insane.
author: Jazlyn H.

description:
cute local coffee shop. i ordered an almond milk latte and a veggie bagel. the husband got a breakfast sandwich with just the right ratio of egg to sausage to veggies.

there is a nice amount of seating outside if you have a dog (there was a bowl of dog treats inside too), which is always a plus! next time i want to try the lox. everyone was friendly and we got our bagels pretty quickly. no complaints!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Im not sure what I've done to the Asian barista to be treated rudely. She is never happy to be there. Today she let a customer cut in front of me without acknowledging me. She very sarcastically told me to have a great day. 

The bagels and drinks are decently priced but is it worth putting up with attitude?
author: Andre W.

description:
wifi password: plainbagel
I love this spot but am very cold right now. Cut it out sf weather. 

Very friendly baristas, good coffee and chill vibe. Tuning out all the coffee shop jams with my big headphones, but I think they are playing good songs. Great place to do some work. There are many outlets and about 6 tables. Not too crowded on a thurs early afternoon.

Outdoor seating available too in case you were curious.
author: Juliana P.

description: The cafe is very cute and is essentially open to the streets. However the coffee quality is mediocre at best (texture of the cappuccino is slightly sandy/grimey). Would not come again especially given there are so many great alternatives than here (simply cafe, arlequin)
author: Cindy G.

description: Great small cafe. A hole in the wall at Hayes valley, great service. It felt a chill spot,which a cafe should be. Simple menu and great price. I'll definitely come back
author: Oscar G.

description: So yum. I live their bagel sandwiches. Actually all their sandwiches are delicious. Perfect combo and they serve them nice and warm.
author: Tee J.

description:
Good local coffee shop. Batista knows all the locals and she is very nice which is good to see because today is overcast and rainy. I got a mocha with whipped cream and chocolate syrup on the top. Delicious! Great place to escape the rain and get a quick pick me up. 

Not a ton of seating here but not super busy so I shared a table with a nice stranger.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Normally a really great spot! Barista/cashier was super friendly. Great bagels. The reason I rated this place 3 stars is because of the person making the sandwiches/bagels. He was SO rude to multiple customers including me. I work in customer service and I understand the struggle but he was just plain rude. For example, a customer asked if a certain order was his and the person working responded with, "Yeah I called it out like 3 times". Once my order was ready, another customer and I got up to grab the item (we ordered the same bagel with cream cheese) which made it awkward. I knew it was mine as I was waiting for at least 10 minutes. A name system would definitely help with orders. 

Definitely would not want to go if he were working.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
Cafe La Vie is a cozy local coffee shop in Hayes Valley.

COFFEE: High quality. They have a Faema manual espresso machine, and their baristas are quite proficient with it.  The coffee is delicious and affordable (3.25 for an espresso macchiato).

ATMOSPHERE: The building want cramped, but there were plenty of people sitting around working.  It was not too loud.  The walls are decorated with local art, and the store front features a comfortable patio.  

WORK ESSENTIALS: plenty of tables and outlets.  Unfortunately I had trouble with their internet while I was here, but I saw others working on it without issue.
author: Colin P.

description: This place has bagels literally dripping with cream cheese. They are very generous with their cream cheese and have a wide variety of luxury teas and bagel flavors. If you love warm melted cream cheese by the tons then this cafe would be an AMAZING place to start you day! Like 20 oz of tea is only 2.50! That's a steal for Hayes Valley! I love this place! What a treat! Must visit if coming to Hayes Valley and a must stop by before going to work each morning!
author: Intava W.

description:
This is one of my favorite little cafes in Hayes Valley - maybe one of my favorites in SF.  In the category of "sit, chill, do some work, sip some coffee, maybe grab a bite to eat", this place does pretty well.  And, it's tucked away not far off the main Hayes Valley drag, but on a quiet street.

You're going to find the regular cafe-fare here.  All the Coffee and Coffee-Drinks you'd expect.  They also have Bagels, Breakfast Sandwiches, Scrambles, Lunch Sandwiches, as well as Pastries.  All the food I've had has been good and fresh-made.  I honestly tend to stick with a simple Bagel with Butter, and Coffee.  Or a Diet Coke, as Adam S. is wont to do.  (They charge $1.25 for a can of Soda - come on man, it should never be more than $1.)

There's a good vibe here overall.  I love the space - it's intimate, but very open.  The front of the cafe opens up entirely (think clear garage door) from the seat-level up.  There is also outdoor seating.  The inside is cozy, and has art on the wall from local artists - which has changed frequently over the last couple of years.  The service is good - although it can be a little slow compared to other spots.  Just be aware if you have to race back to the office.  But that said, they're not slow because of bad service, they just make things fresh and it's not a soul-less assembly line.  They take the time to talk.  

Winner.  I like having it near the office.  And, who cares if it takes a little longer - I've learned over the years the the office will almost always be there when you get back.
author: Adam S.

description: Sip the Old World in New San Francisco. Café La Vie is a vibrant example of the dying breed of the neighborhood café and coffee shop. Strong coffee and espressos, local ownership, room to sit and talk. WiFi and power strips. And a big cannister of chocolate powder to top off any foamy beverage. Stephanie the barista and owner is super friendly and positive. Plug in and recharge to an Old World vibe right here.
author: Ben G.

description:
After reading the reviews on here, I realized I'm not alone!  I live and work in the area. Excited to find a cafe in the neighborhood, but after the rude and disrespectful encounter I had with the barista... NEVER AGAIN! 

YOU WANT RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL WITH YOUR COFFEE, BY ALL MEANS VISIT THIS PLACE!

As I sip the coffee purchased from this cafe, the barista calls my attention and tells me "Are you really going to just sit there and not buy anything? If you're going to sit here, you need to buy something to eat or drink. This is only for customers who purchase things." I understand this rational, but what followed is a different story. 

My friend tells him that I am drinking the coffee that was purchased 15 mins ago. I confirm this. He said oh, and apologizes with a very sassy attitude. Then adds, "you don't need to look at me like that as I already apologized." I was puzzled as I was looking at him with confusion. As I sit there, he doesn't stop talking but continues to tell me that I don't have to take his apology. He keeps retionalizing. I literally just packed up my stuff, and told him "don't worry i'm leaving." As i'm leaving, his parting words to me was "I guess i'm talking to the wrong customer!"
author: Eileen A.

description: Today,Thursday 28th, I found this place good rated in my maps while walking around. We came in and the barista was the most unwelcome person I've seen in my first trip to San Francisco. He barely answered our questions about the coffee, even tho we were so nice asking him and interested in the place. He was was about then about to close and started yelling at everyone: "what's is wrong with you guys? What part of I'm closing you cannot understand"?. I looks so upset with his own life I thought he was gonna poison my drink. His haircut and face tattoos were as bas a his attitude: gross. It was so bad I had to write this review right after this happened. Of course everyone left the place before he could get even more mad at everyone. He needs a therapist, and a new haircut.
author: Juan L.

description:
Excellent, generously sized mocha. Chocolate strong but not bitter. 

Good quality tea, but definitely go coffee if you're here. 

Cashier/Barista/DJ was on an R. Kelly kick. Super friendly, great vibes.
author: Will M.

description:
This place is absolutely ADORABLE. The staff is super friendly, the tea that my boyfriend got was delicious, and the seating area is just really comfy. 

We came here when it was raining one day and all the seats except for the couch in the back was taken. There was another couple there, but it was big enough for all 4 of us to sit comfortably while I charged my phone. I also worked on some homework here because they have free wifi. It was quiet enough to get some work done too.

I love the decor of this place too. Absolutely homey/European/quaint feeling. If there was a Cafe La Vie where I lived, it would definitely be my go-to coffee and studying spot.

The drink my boyfriend got was called Foggy SF or something like that, and it was simply almond milk with black tea, but it was delicious. My boyfriend liked it and he's not even a huge fan of tea. I don't really get some of the 3 star reviews on here because I really liked this place.

It is small, but I think that's what adds to the charm and why I liked it.
author: Hana B.

description:
I love cafe la vie. I go there almost everyday because I work in the neighborhood and their bagels and drinks are so good!
But these past two days. I found a young Asian girl who is so grumpy and arrogant. Yesterday she gave me really bad costumer service , And ruined my sandwich. I told her I did not want onions but she still added them, and she did not add cucumber even though I asked her for it. Also, right after touching the cash register, she started making my sandwich without a glove or cleaning her hands, which was disgusting because I have worked in tens of different restaurants and sanitization should be a priority. but I still decided to go this morning to get a drink as I always do, and I found her again.
She always seems to hate her job, always grumpy and impolite.
I got a hot chocolate and I reminded her to give me the neighborhood discount as I always get because I work nearby. She said she did apply it but when I looked at the receipt, I found out she did NOT. So she lied to me.
I was standing in front of her, but she did put my cup in the other side of the counter and just screamed"hot chocolate!!". When I asked her politely to add some whipped cream she did not look at me at all and she did it with anger slamming the door of the fridge.
Sorry cafe la vie, je vous aime. But because of that person I won't be coming back!
author: Reda D.

description: I've been coming here for sinse they opened in 2004(?) and I love it. The only old-school Hayes Valley spot left in the hood.  Sam and her dad have created a truly welcoming spot, friendly, real San Franciscans baristas, the breakfast sandwiches are top notch and priced right too.  Love the vibe and lack of pretension of this place and of course the free wi-fi and the glass garage door they open on nice days.
author: Him S.

description:
My friend and I needed to take shelter from the freezing wind, so it was just our luck that we stumbled upon this place. Great location! Not a lot of noise, but close to all the fun stuff in Hayes Valley! Perfect ambience for studying for chatting with a friend.

Really friendly cashier! I ordered a large hot chocolate with whipped cream which tasted delicious and was exactly what I needed. Prices are no more than what you would pay at Starbucks which is really great for this neighborhood.

The cafe is very nicely decorated but a little small, so I imagine it may be hard to find a seat on a busier day. The whole front of the store is actually a single garage door which is pretty cool. I imagine on a warmer summer day, it would be really nice to sit out front as well.

Even though we stayed until they were pretty much closed, the workers were very kind and made us feel no pressure that we had to leave. Really glad I found this place!
author: Eric Z.

description:
This is my favorite cafe in the area and there are alot of great cafes in Hayes Valley!

I love seeing the regulars and the friendly staff, the ambience is very comforting and chill. The music is always good and the coffee is always great. The iced coffee is also very good.

I like how they put the half & half in a push-down dispenser, rather than having to pour it. They also have spoons to use, so they keep it eco-friendly.

My favorite thing about this cafe has to be the breakfast and lunch bagels! They are not over-priced and are made perfectly with lots of love (seriously)!

My recommendation is the Veggie Bagel (w/ either hummus or cream cheese) served Open Faced (for $1 extra). The healthiest and most delicious way to enjoy a bagel! The egg sandwiches are also very tasty!
author: Kimia M.

description: awesome bagel creations...pretty rare in a small cafe, but these folks rock it every time...coffee (depth charge) always hits the mark.
author: C S.

description:
I mean, it is exactly how Yelp defines the 3-star rating... A-OK. 

The cafe is small, not too much sitting area - it's a cute little space. I liked that the menu is written chalk style on the side of the wall, though it does expanse the entire wall so you have to take a step back to take it all in.

I came here for breakfast and ordered a poppy seed bagel with cream cheese and the boyfriend ordered a garlic bagel lox sandwich. However, somehow along the lines I guess the barista forgot and switched the bagels. Not a big deal, except that I really wanted that poppy seed bagel and now it has been covered in salmon...aaaand it was the last poppy seed bagel. So now, I'm just the littlest bit annoyed because the garlic bagel was really nothing amazing. I mean just such a meh-bagel. Like why do you even bother making this bagel? Could barely taste the garlic.

I also ordered the spicy chai drink - which for $4 for the smallest size, I was expecting more than literally just tea. Like maybe even a latte even? But that is my bad for not reading the menu carefully enough. Would not recommend. Drank less than half and ended up tossing it.

Overall, its a cute place to come and study and hang out but food/beverage wise as a cafe? Could definitely do better elsewhere.

Pro-tip: it's dog friendly. They have this jar of doggy biscuits for your p-awesome furry friends. I'm pretty sure they are complimentary because this old man came in and kept feeding his adorable sweater-wearing pooch with them.
author: Josephine T.

description:
Small place better for coffees and sandwiches as there's no actual stovetop. All their food items are prepared with a microwave and toaster oven. Keep that in mind when you order. Ordering the scramble was a MISTAKE, but the other items didn't look half bad. Their coffee items are where it's at. Didn't even have to add sugar to the americano!

It's a pretty casual place with big open windows, great for people watching. However, there are FLIES that get in and get bothersome. There's also noise pollution from motorcycles and cars passing by, but if you like the hustle and bustle, then you'd like this spot. 

There are few tables outside, and about five tables inside. They don't mind people hanging out for extended periods as they offer plenty of outlets on extension cords. The place was decently crowded, but there was usually open seating. The SPOTTY INTERNET ranged from 13.5 Mbps down / 3 Mbps up when it worked to 1 Mbps down... 

Don't know if I'd come back here as there are so many other coffee shops to try. However, this is an acceptable neighborhood joint with reasonable prices. All the staff were also super friendly and nice.
author: Audrey L.

description: Can't understand what people mean when they say this place is cute and cozy I found it anything but.. As far as coffee it was the worst cappuccino I ever had and the chocolate croissant was ice-cold! I would give it zero stars if I could.
author: Margareta E.

description: Although I love these bagels and prices are amazing, I am not sure I can continue to put up with the young Asian lady who works there. She terrifies me. She is rude and almost always messes up my sandwiches. Today I went back, because again - I did not get what I paid for and she was unapologetic and very annoyed at the fact that I dared to say she made a mistake.
author: D H.

description:
Stopped by on a weekend because I needed a place to chill and pass time. I was originally going to go to Artis Coffee across the street, but it was too small and too crowded. Cafe La Vie is still pretty small too, but was quieter and less crowded. I LOVE how cozy it is! I found a table in the back with pillows on the bench - super comfy spot to work (there's free wifi!) or catch up with friends.

They serve coffee/tea here and food as well. I didn't order anything to eat here, but had a small SPICED CHAI ($2.95). Nothing special but not bad.
author: Jessie L.

description: A true cute little cafe so if you are European or just like this small mom & pop vibe, it's a perfect place. We only tried their drinks vs food but the espresso & tea were solid.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: Came to the city for a work event today. Was so grateful to find a good cup of coffee,nice music, and free wifi. They let me work for a few hours undisturbed until my first event. Great place! Would definitely come back!
author: Quinn C.

description:
Hipster cafe shop that is located in Hayes Valley.  

The interior decor is rather unique and they utilize the small space that they have. 

I ordered up their breakfast croissant and coffee.  It hit the spot for an early morning before a walk along the Land's End Trail.

I like the versatile, wide open and close window that they have.  The morning breeze makes it quite leisurely to kick back while sipping on coffee and munching on a snack.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Great local cafe with a great vibe and delicious croissant sandwiches. I worked here for a few hours on a Saturday morning without space problems and good wifi.
author: Ronnie P.

description:
It smells like something is constantly burning. Someone here doesn't know how to use the toaster oven. I don't know about the food but the coffee was okay. I think I rather go to Ritual across the street. 

I'm writing this review mainly to talk about wheelchair accessibility. The bathroom is pretty cramped so I had a hard time trying to get in. Which is fine. A lot of places in SF are (unfortunately) like that. What really pissed me off was the barista smirking at me from behind the counter. Okay, asshole, glad you're having fun watching me struggle with my wheelchair. 

Only added the extra star because they're providing the wifi I'm using to write this bad review.
author: Joey Y.

description:
The egg sandwiches are amazing! I always get one before I start my day and it's just what I need. The people who work here are super friendly and provide very quick service. 

On top of the great food/drink and friendly faces, the atmosphere is also inviting. There's a giant "garage style" window that is rolled up to open up the space on pleasantly (or excruciatingly) warm days.
author: Nicole G.

description: Cute little shop. It's a nice environment. I got a bagel and tea. Not too expensive, and delicious. They're puppy friendly with a jar of free treats for furry friends! Love it
author: Sarah C.

description: Perfect, affordable way to start your day with a kick! I had the egg sandwich on brioche (the only way to go) plus a cappuccino. Coffee takes a while to prepare but its worth it, and the pastries are great too!
author: Sally B.

description:
Needed a place for coffee on a rainy Sunday and saw that this place had some pretty good reviews so decided to give it a try. The place is a pretty small cafe--definitely the small and cozy feel. I went solely for the latte which was pretty meh... I don't feel like penalizing the restaurant as a whole though just because it seems like some of their other food might be good? The coffee does pale though and if you're in Hayes Valley, you're better off walking a minute to Ritual or Blue Bottle if you're looking for a good latte. 

Otherwise, cute cozy place to get some work done.
author: Jasmine X.

description:
It's a tranquil cafe near Patricia Green.  Coffee is good, so is Lox bagel.  The price is reasonable.  But you might have to share a table sometimes.
Get your tablet to enjoy the free WiFi.
author: Wing W.

description:
Cute little place I passed by on my way to Loving Cup while I was craving something sweet. I decided to pass on the froyo and just grab an iced chai from here instead but that was a mistake. It was very watered down and didn't satisfy my tastebuds at all  However, prices are very reasonable and I think I need to come back and try something else again. 

Ps: 4 stars because I accidentally gave the nice cashier a dollar extra and he gave it back to me! Honest and friendly folks who just love what they do!
author: Emily Y.

description: Actually large coffees for $2.50. Delicious, filling, bagel egg cheese for a reasonable price. Friendly service. This place is a bargain by SF standards. One of the best cafes in Hayes.
author: Steve D.

description: Ordered a sandwich without egg.  The guy specifically asked to confirm that I didn't want egg.  Sandwich had egg.
author: John W.

description:
I didn't want to review this place because it's my fav local neighborhood spot to grab a bagel and SF fog (Paris tea with steamed almond milk. It'll change your life - just get it) and I don't want to give away this hidden gem. However, they deserve it and I'm just being selfish.

Great tea lattes, bagels and breakfast sandwiches. It'll be the one place I miss in Hayes whenever I move. Well that and loving cup :)
author: W H.

description: I got a latte and a turkey egg croissant sandwich ($5). I definitely recommend the sandwiches here. It comes with a selection of vegetables and cheese. :+1: There seemed to be just the right amount of seating to get my work done (Thurs).
author: Ariella V.

description:
Great neighborhood joint, small and off the main road. Great for studying and nicest baristas! On nice days they roll up the garage door style street face - combined with light music and Internet - makes this a great study spot. 
The setback... The garlic/onion smell (bagels) is making me dizzy, even with half my head out the window. The flies inside like it though.
author: Eva A.

description:
Happened to be in the area for a few hours and this place came up on Yelp so decided to give it a try - turns out, it was a great decision.

The storefront is pretty simple and easy to overlook, but the inside is cozy and comfortable. A healthy assortment of pillows and cushions line the windowsill closest to the door, creating a comfy seating area for work. There's also ample charger strips littered around the cafe, so you really don't have to worry about fighting your neighbor for a slot. The interior is a bit on the smaller side though, I was guess max seating capacity of about 20 people.

What really resonated with me, however, was the personality of the staff members here and how they interact with other patrons. This place seems to be a popular spot for locals, as nearly everyone in line before me struck up a casual, friendly conversation with the barista. Definitely a no judgment, good vibes place to hang out. 

Prices are very affordable, and very deserving of the 1 dollar sign. Unfortunately, I did take off a star because they closed their kitchen at 4pm, 2 hours before they close. Quite a shame too, as their sandwich selections looked robust and interesting, and clock in at around $6-$7. Regardless, I'd love to come back to this place frequently and definitely will next time I'm in the area.
author: Chen-Chen H.

description: Friendly staff, spicy chai that's not overly sweet, and really yummy veggie burger. They are also dog friendly. If the weather is nice they open the window. The space is on the smaller side though so you might not always get a table inside if you are looking to study or browse the Internet.
author: Maria T.

description:
Good place to grab a quick lunch and get some work done. This place is super small and does not have a lot of seating. Sometimes the smell form the people smoking outside is very cumbersome. 

The super lox (previously called the slamin salmon) bagel is super yummy and their hot chocolate is also very smooth and creamy--all the things they should be. 

Free wifi and a couple of outlets if you need to fuel up your devices.
author: Anna H.

description:
Been here twice, both times they just forgot my order immediately after ordering it.

Ordered two bagels, yet they were too busy multitasking to even remember I had paid them for something.
author: Aaron S.

description:
This cafe looks way cuter in the fotos. This place was a bit dingy and dirty. Guess it's the "hipster" feel of Hayes Valley. Idk.

The Internet was down when I was here. Tried some English muffin sandwich bc they ran out of bagels by 1pm!! A couple went to a mart nearby to buy their own bagels so the server could make the bagel sandwich. The server was cool, friendly, but Cafe La Vie did not execute on this particular day.
author: Suji C.

description:
Veggie bagel was awesome.
There's sriracha to spice it up.
Currant scone was awesome. Bread part tasted like lemon! Soft inside with slightly crisp outside.

Girl working was super friendly with everyone who came in. She was really helpful, quick, and relaxed.
Coffee was really dark for my taste but she gave me the gallon of milk to dilute it a bit.

Inside is really cute but really small: 5 tables inside, 1 outside.
There is a power strip  under front table to provide outlets for laptop work/study!

Didn't try espresso drinks so I feel wrong giving 5 stars without trying those. Really awesome place.
author: Sarah E.

description:
Was recently in the area and needed wifi and felt like a coffee so I dropped by. 

Service was mixed. The cashier was super friendly and welcoming but the other guy prepping the food seemed pretty rude, unfriendly and borderline obnoxious. 

I ordered a drip coffee and it was terrible at best. The type of drip coffee that makes instant coffee taste good. Maybe this was not the thing to order?

A lot of people came in for bagels and breakfast sandwiches so maybe this is what the place is known for and offsets the terrible drip. The prices also seem really cheap which could be another reason for the steady stream of customers. 

The free wifi was reasonably fast which is always nice, since wifi is hit or miss in the city these days. 

The place is pretty small and if you sit near the front and the smell of smoke is mildly irritating you might not enjoy it. 

If you just want a coffee there are a lot of better options nearby (Blue Bottle, Ritual, etc).
author: Brent F.

description: My wife loves this place. It's the only spot to get a bagel in the neighborhood. Coffee still sucks though. Evidently the sandwiches are good. And I'm obviously less bitter than 6 years ago
author: Jackson D.

description:
Come by and grab your cup of sass and food to go!

PROS
- Windowed wall opens up and allows a lot of sunshine in
- Warm, small gas fireplace
- Sassy barista with impeccable service
- Cheap and tasty food ($4-$10)
- Good WIFI


CONS
- Seating is limited and not super spacious
- All the smells and bugs from outside get inside
- Sassy barista is some sasssssy shit
- Limited selection of food (more akin to a Philz than a Starbucks)
- Got the floor stereo so music has to be manually turned back on every 2 hours.

My friend Greg and I were working at http://www.yelp.com/biz/arlequin-cafe-and-food-to-go-san-francisco, which has a beautiful garden out back. But you definitely pay a premium on the food. Also, the WIFI absolutely SUCKED that day! But then we came here. I met the friendly barista and got faster internet believe it or not. Café La Vie HALLELUJAH!

I wouldn't bring my smell-sensitive boyfriend to hang out here, but I'd be more than happy to visit here with outdoor-loving friends like Greg anytime!
author: Frances S.

description: I will keep this review short and to the point.  The barista Sam is rude, unprofessional and frankly disgusting.   She acts like she doesn't want to be there and that's okay.  You don't have to say hello when someone says good morning to you. Just keep giving them that blank stare that clearly says I hate my job.  Fine I don't bother with pleasantries with her like I do with the other barista.  But when you serve people rotten food you have crossed the line.  I ordered a veggie bagel with avocado which is extra and a medium hot chocolate.  I noticed my cup felt light but I was like whatever Sam made it.  When I was at my desk I open the cup and it was only 2/3 full.  My bagel had about a spoonful of avocado that I paid extra for and it was brownish/black and clearly rotten.  This was all done deliberately. I could tell she has a nasty attitude from the moment I placed my order. Was it because I was as friendly to her has she was to me? Most definitely.  I threw everything away because a. I don't eat rotten food and   b. I would not have put it past her to have spit in my drink.
author: JD m.

description:
Some of the nastiest, meaniest, sulkiest hostesses/ baristas.  Um, you work at a coffee shop, do you understand there is a world out there where they actually do way more important things?
It's always unpleasant to go in here, as you never know what kind of attitude you will get. The coffee is good, and the food good but the attitude horrendous.  I hope the owner reads this!!

Update: a woman named Sarah who works there wrote something horrible to me. Judge for yourself if someone can be ethical in what they put in your food if they act like this
author: Michele Y.

description: Aside from having a crush on the register girl, I thought the croissant egg sandwich had some major value. $5 and you can basically put whatever you want on it. The chai tea latte (almond milk) was horrible but oh well. Enjoyed my time here.
author: Michael A.

description: enjoyed my cappuccino with almond milk very much, especially because it was served by such a friendly barista :) vibe is super relaxed and homey--not like your typical sterile hipster cafes popping up around sf nowadays heh
author: Michelle C.

description:
This is my ride or die neighborhood coffee shop. Locally owned and operated. Highly recommend the egg sandwiches and conversations with the owner/employees.

This spot has great vibes. For example, I just finished teaching the owner how to Moonwalk.

Get off your butt and get in here!
author: Jordan K.

description: Really great veggie bagel. My chai was pretty bland, though. Threw it away after a few sips.
author: Megan D.

description: Cozy little haven in the midst of marina-esque cafes and boutiques. Reasonably priced drinks and food, wifi, and friendly staff. Good for people watching. Outdoor seating on nice days is a plus. Large tables good for sharing with strangers! Delicious soy latte.
author: Michelle K.

description: Love this little cafe. Old wood floors, arty decor, mellow music, tons of light, free WiFi, personable staff and unlike their competitors in the neighborhood, reasonably priced for San Francisco.
author: Scott H.

description:
I love love love Cafe La Vie!

I recently moved to Hays valley and have been working my way through the plentiful coffee shops to find the one that would be my "spot".  Cafe La Vie is it!  Here is what I love about it in no particular order.

1.  It's a real neighborhood spot.  Everyone who goes here seems to be regulars.  It's not a chain and it's not super flashy.  The staff are super friendly and actually remember who I am after I've been in a few times.

2.  It's sooooooo cheap!  For $2.45 I get a Cafe Au Lait that is HUGE, like a bucket of coffee (equivalent to a Starbucks Venti).  It's on the same quality level as all the other neighborhood spots (Boulange, Grove, Arlequin, etc...).  You can get a huge egg+cheese+meat+veggie bagel sandwhich for $3.95.  My husband had it and loved it.  Simple but great.  Their oatmeal with fresh fruitl is only $2.50!  The places mentioned above charged $5-$8 for an oatmeal and some dont even offer fresh fruit.  

3.  Their havea huge assortment of cookies that are vegan from "Alternative Baking Company".  From the taste you'd NEVER know it, you have to read the fine print on the pack.  

Thanks Cafe La Vie for being so great!  I hope you stay in business forever and ever.
author: Evelyn N.

description: I sat down outside for literally 30 seconds and was deciding what I wanted to order before the woman behind the table told me the table was for customers only, so I left. I get it if I was there for 20 minutes just hanging out but that was just bad service and bad business. Won't be coming back here again.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yep: small space... BUT indoor space unlike a few of the open-air stands around.  More importantly Samantha gave me what I wanted unlike the pretentious other SF cafe's who "don't serve 16 oz, only 12" and don't have flavors, insisting I take my latte plain...  Please:  I'm a grown ass man.  I know how I like my coffee.  Here's a great idea SF: Just serve me what I want.

Samantha at Café La Vie did just that.  What I wanted.   Great pour.  Great foam.  The size I requested.  The flavor I requested.  Recommended.
author: M F.

description: Absolutely adorable cafe, with friendly baristas. Unfortunately I can only make it here on my days off, but I always look forward to my visits. I usually get a triple iced white mocha, delicious BTW, but on the days I'm hungover and can't handle that much milk just the espresso with a little sugar is like heaven. Honestly it's the best espresso I've ever had. And last but not least, the sausage egg and cheese croissant always hits the spot. They also have rather low prices :)
author: Sandy G.

description:
Nice, somewhat rundown place to sit and get some work done while in the area. Quieter than La Boulange. Coffee quality varies extremely - one week the small latte in a mug (nice - no paper) was actually good and the barrista said - pay anytime before you leave which makes you feel comfortable- next week I ordered the same, paid my $2.85 right away, latte arrived in a mug with latte art - one sip and the rest of the completely undrinkable watery concoction went back. Left a bad taste in my mouth in every sense of the term. 

If the big chains get one thing right, its QC - quality control. Please train the barristas and you have a winner.
author: Flo B.

description:
Found this place as we were looking for a coffee shop to work from for a few hours on a Friday. Free wifi, available outlets, laid back space.
Large open windows made us feel like we were sitting outside & rich scents from the African store next door plus interesting characters passing by added to the experience. Chuck Berry tunes lifted up the mood.
author: Lena R.

description: Nice place to work on a weekday. Very laid back staff. Small inside.
author: Elle R.

description: My favorite cafe in Hayes Valley because of the lack of pretentiousness and the fast, delicious breakfast sandwiches.
author: Trey F.

description:
A coffee shop in San Francisco where the vibe isn't pretentious is rare. Here, the staff are whimsical and the patrons incredibly laid back. Tucked away on Octavia close to the intersection of Hayes, most people don't even realize it's there. This part of Hayes with the strip of grass always resembles a miniature toyland, and the newest addition, the cute green Juice Shop van certainly adds to that vibe.

La Vie is quite simply, real. Wifi with purchase (be respectful, avoid being that squatter who rides for hours on one cup of joe), simple no fuss sandwiches, breakfast (bagels, toast, pb&j, lox), and good strong coffee and espresso. Window seats, small tables against the wall, and my personal favorite, the table in the back with the fireplace are available depending on your mood/weather. 

My favorite coffee tenders, Kim and PK make this place feel like home away from home and George the owner drops in daily with a smile on his face. As I write this review I'm realizing 80% of people around me have PCs. If that isn't an indicator that this cafe is unique I don't know what is.
author: M S.

description:
wonderful wifi connection. 
great coffee w/cookies. (even decaf!)
there was great vibe and a really activity step. she knew everyone who came to store!
just one thing to bad is closed time(6:00pm). 
i wanted to stay more;(
anyway lets try here!
author: Junghee H.

description:
Awesome kind staff. Very helpful to patrons who want specifics on their sandwich. 
DOG FRIENDLY!! so friendly that they have treats for them! Love the space and art too!
author: Manu M.

description: Small and honest local coffee shops are somewhat hard to find in SF. It has everything you want and nothing you don't: good bagels, good coffee, friendly staff, comfortable, welcoming to everyone; no long lines of bros and hipsters, no techies networking, no trendy furniture, no tourists, not pretending to be a Parisian cafe. There are thousands of places like this all over the world, but it is special in SF.
author: K T.

description:
Cafe La Vie is David in a two-block radius of Goliaths.

Blue Bottle. Ritual. La Boulange. There are countless reasons to pick another coffee dwelling over Cafe La Vie.

But just like "The Hurt Locker" in the 2010 Academy Awards, this small, independent shop has more charm and flavor than the rest combined and I guarantee it will win you over. 

Almost all of the front of the store is a large garage door that's kept open and provides a constant connection between the strong brewing beans and the valley in which it's being consumed. There's enough room for about 8-10 people to sit inside with a few more hugging the perimeter in tables and chairs. 

The service is what caught my eye. I don't remember the barista's name, but she was so personable. And not in a "she said 'hello' and smiled" way but rather in a "I want to be her new best friend" way. It was a warm afternoon and I asked if they had iced coffee and she said "duh. I'm not serving you hot coffee. You'll pass out." We got into a discussion on who would be more likely to pass out. She let me know the (free) wireless password and I was on my way to the back where I drank my (surprisingly delicious) soy-infused cold treat.

The only downfall is that the seating isn't ideal if you're working on a laptop. Whether you're in the L-shaped booth in the back or the seating area up front, the tables are well below your normal reaching level and you either have to bend over a lot or sit with your laptop in your lap (imagine that). 

If the tables get higher or the seats get lower, I think Cafe La Vie is well on its way to obliterating the local Avatars of Hayes Valley. Blue aliens vs yummy coffee? 

My money is on Cafe La Vie.
author: Jared S.

description:
If you just came back from NY and are looking for a lox bagel, you can get one here for $5.25.  They're generous with the fish and include the works: capers, red onions, salt, and pepper.  Unfortunately, it did leave me wanting something better and the fish could be more fresh.  I know we're not in NY but we're in SF for goodness sake!  Surely you could rummage for some better fish.

Cafe Mocha tasted particularly better and was lacking the richness that it could potentially have.  I don't' see a strong reason to come back but it does seem a nice pace to read and/or study.  The place was packed on a Saturday morning but for food/drink, you could go nearby to Stacks, La Boulange, etc.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Good spot by the window. Coffee was served in a mug, which I liked.  Good assortment of sugars if you want, they even had flavored water. You can then put your coffee in a paper cup after, if you don't finish. 
Bagels were good.  There was not a stove around, so everything is done in a microwave.  Overall sausage bagel sandwich was good, better with Cholula on it. Salmon lox was good too. 
It's great to see a quiet Hayes neighborhood in the morning.
author: Edgar A.

description: Fantastic cafe. I ordered a bagel and a cafe latte. Both were perfectly prepared. Charming location. Feels like Europe. I am definitely coming back.
author: Vici P.

description:
cute furniture and decor, yet doesn't feel pretentious at all. the prices are relatively low for SF, and the latte i ordered was quite tasty (no latte art, though). free wifi and always-available seating make for a good place to laptop-camp for the day.
minus 1 star for dinky, damp-smelling bathroom with weak-flushing toilet and occasional burning smells (possibly from crumbs not being cleaned from their toaster).
author: Chia-Fen Y.

description: This is my favorite spot in Hayes Valley. Not only do they have good coffee and great food (try the vegie bagel with hummus and avocado) they also have a great place and a very diverse patronage, not the army of clones you find in some other places. The terrace is fantastic, in the shadow of beautiful trees. And the waiters are always super friendly. Oh and they have wifi and power outlets.
author: Thomas F.

description: Really really fun place to visit with a group. We ended up spending over 5 hours there, and never felt pressured to leave even though it was busy. Excellent collection and the staff are very helpful and friendly.
author: Garnett S.

description: This place is great if you want to wait in line for ten minutes for them to tell you they don't have half of what is on he menu. Great example of why small coffee places are dying.
author: Hayes T.

description:
14.08.08                Visited this place multiple times
                               Great place to hide out on a hot day
                                           large open faced storefront
                                           several large trees shading the sidewalk
    


Drinks----------------- 3 1/2
Service  --------------- 4
Place    ---------------  4

Solid nice small neighborhood cafe.
Super attentive and sincerely friendly lady ... u can see for yourself
I love this comfortable place over
      La Boulange
      Blue Bottle Kiosk
      The Grove

Comfortable, Friendly, non pretentious (considering the area is full of yuppies
                               fashion conscious, brand name conscious, people, coffee snob,
                               food snobs (well I kinda fall a little in this category ... i like to 
                                                      step back to bread and butter places)

A great place to chill inside or under the trees on mild or hot day.
Don't get wrong ... the place is beautifully decorated ... just check it out
      especially on a hot day ... those large trees and open storefront ....


Not from the neighborhood ... But I always drop by to chill when I am down here ...
One of my recommended 10 cafe to chill ... of 100+ citywide
author: S.K. Y.

description: I've been a regular here for years. Great iced coffee, double brewed option. Great place in Hayes Valley.
author: KK L.

description:
Nice looking cafe with wifi. 
The scramble egg with meat, cheese and veggie was bland.
Service was not especially friendly.
author: Jess C.

description: Awesome, nice, cool, VERY FAIR PRICED coffees and the staff is all nice. I personally have a HUGE crush on Irwin but he doesn't even know it. The breakfast sandwiches are great and they are always fast, nice, and the space is relaxed. Way better then La Boulange across the street.
author: Brian W.

description: Cozy cafe off Hayes with a fire going on in the wall in the corner. Nice place to catch up with a friend or to read a book.
author: Sherry L.

description: The barista guy was so unfriendly. He didn't say anything when i ordered and got the coffee. So i thought that he cannot talk. Super rude that i've ever experienced.
author: Yousun H.

description:
I'm a regular here, even though there's Ritual coffee and Blue Bottle just around the corner, I always go to la Vie. 
They make great coffee, play nice music, free wifi. And I highly recommend those breakfast sandwiches! I like croissant/turkey/cheddar
author: Anjelika P.

description:
So many things in life can be explained by the generalization that most people follow the path of least resistance most of the time.  That explains why businesses on main streets tend to be so crowded (and pay such high rents).  Cafe La Vie is a great example of what happens when you stray off that path --  but in this case, we're taking like 50 feet!  Barely off Hayes, yet I have to admit I never noticed it before reading about it here on Yelp.

La Vie is the quintessential locals' place.  La Boulange on the corner is much larger but often mobbed.  The justifiably famous Ritual is just up Octavia (in the heavily trafficked park area), and the more famous Blue Bottle kiosk around the corner on Linden.  If you want a full(er) menu, La Boulange is the only option.  For really gourmet Third Wave artisanal coffee, I don't think you can beat Ritual and Blue Bottle (matter of personal preference; for me, BB is the winner), but the lines can get outrageous at times and neither offers any indoor space to chill or work or study.  Perfectly good coffee here, reasonable prices, no lines or crowds, friendly neighborhood vibe.  This is the kind of place that makes me want to move to Hayes Valley.
author: Antone J.

description:
When I tell people that I live in Hayes Valley, they often say... "oooh I love going to blue bottle coffee!"
Which makes my eyes roll back into my head. 
If they actually wanted delicious coffee, they would know to go to Cafe La Vie. 

The staff is great. Jessica will be sure to give you a laugh, or a hard time. Which, incidentally, may make you laugh. Also, the streets are really flat.

It is mostly the best cafe in SF, because I live across the street, 

The afternoons are really slow here, it makes it nice to sit and read or work.. or whatever. It's slow and there is space. You could probably take a nap and not be in the way of anyone. But, I don't know if the staff would like it. Though, they're so nice, they may not say anything at all.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
I serendipitously first met my (now) husband at this coffeeshop, after living in Hayes Valley for 2 years and slowly becoming friends with the owner, George.  (please say hi to George for me. He's there early in the morning and sometimes parties there on Friday nights).  So of course, I owe a lot to this little coffeeshop.

Great bagels, lattes, a cozy fireplace on cold July mornings, creative artwork on display, and free treats for the pup.  Perfect place to bring a book and relax.
author: Grace W.

description: Great place to get your breakfast or hangout all day.  The prices are good for the area and very tasty. Had a latte which was good, not as creamy as say, Blue Bottle the foam did not have the texture but overall not a bad.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere and makes a perfect place to hangout and work. Try it out!
author: Frank C.

description: Holy cow, it's true - super nice barista, the wifi works, cool tunes, reasonable prices. Works for me!
author: Deb T.

description: Nice little place across the street from my apt. I come here almost every weekend and the coffee is great, plus the egg sandwiches are delicious. That meal is less than $7 - can't get that deal at the La Boulange across the street.
author: Matt D.

description: A favorite morning stop. Excellent service, decent breakfast and coffee, and the prices that aren't stupid-high like the rest of the neighborhood. The staff is the best too, always super friendly. Definitely a good alternative to standing in line at Blue Bottle, Ritual, or Arlequin, if you're going for food as well.
author: Christian S.

description: Love the open garage door. Super tiny and comfy, nice couch...
author: Denise M.

description: We walked past this cafe many times and I always wanted to hang out here because it looked like a really nice place. I finally got the chance to check it out but I was really disappointed. The coffee was okay, the breakfast bagel was okay, but the person behind the counter was not at all helpful and actually made me feel like I was wasting her time. Maybe you have to be a regular here to be treated nicely. I guess I'm not going to find out because I'm not coming back.
author: A C.

description: What a sweet little place. Great tasting coffee served by a kind and friendly staff. Nice outdoor seating too. It was on the cool side but it looks like the  garage door wall goes up on nicer days. The only reason I took one star off was because the bagels were good but not off the charts good. Definitely going back.
author: W R.

description:
The best white mocha ever!!!
the girl who work there is a rock star!! super friendly super nice and remember me after my first visit. Knowing what i like what I wanna order...girl...you rocked!!

white mocha chocolate mixed perfectly well with foaming milk. 
if I don't wanna have too much caffeine of that day, she even does half regular coffee half decaf for me. sweet huh. 

love this place....
author: JustinE Y.

description: I ended up here looking for (and finding) wi-fi when my hotel's system was down, and fell in love with it.  The view out the window is my favorite SF sight thus far (after several trips to the city)--a narrow street, trees turning color, a pair of older guys sitting in chairs on the sidewalk chatting, and across the street a really arresting old house with a medieval-looking metal grille gate, all perfect on a moody fall morning.  The espresso was cheap and good.  If anyone buys the little portrait on the wall ($45 and worth it) that looks kind of like Branwell Bronte's painting of his sister Emily before I scare up the cash to do it I will be very annoyed. The music selection is eclectic and atmospheric.
author: Suzanne E.

description:
I'm in love with this place.  The workers, the drinks, the menu items... all in all I go 3 or 4 times a week!

My favorites are the bagel breakfast sandwiches made to order while you wait.  There is also a new tea blend called "Paris" that should not be missed.  

La Vie has a very California vibe; go with the idea of a pleasant experience to start your morning and enjoy.  During slower shifts there is only one person on schedule so allow a quick minute, but it's worth it.  There is seating inside and a bit outside, and La Vie has this clear garage door / window they open up on pleasant days.  Highly recommend!
author: Kevin S.

description:
It seemed like a good place to work but the internet connection is awful.  

The coffee (Mr. Espresso, organic) is decent, strong and reasonably priced ($2.50/$3.05/$3.35) though I was thinking Blue Bottle is so close - only they don't have seating or wi-fi; the foam on my latte was decorated with a heart and the veggie bagels ($3.50) are very good.  The addition of creamy avocado to the cream cheese, red onions, cucumber and tomato makes a big difference (good veggie bagel).  They also have scones, danish, croissants, yogurt parfaits, cookies, and sandwiches (typical coffee house menu).

The place is small and cozy with local art on the walls and a fireplace.  The chairs, even the padded ones, aren't comfortable.  But there are plenty of power outlets for your laptop, free wi-fi and a bathroom.  The wi-fi connection was horrible and unstable.  

I liked how they let fresh air in but then so many people started smoking by the door that the smoke entered the cafe.  And the cafe became so stuffy that I kept smelling some guy's cologne over and over.  Homeless people drifted in and out (which is understandable, it is SF) and someone who wasn't blind entered with his dogs (health code violation). 

The spotty, slow internet connection was very frustrating.  I've said it three times now.  I was ready to hurt someone.
author: Lolia S.

description: Delicious cappuccino. Friendly barista. Knew I had just got my hair done and knows my wonderful hairdresser. Very cozy.
author: Geri S.

description:
On my way to volunteer at the hospice (you know, in between saving babies and bringing world peace), I make a pit-stop here to grab a cup of joe.  Hayes Valley is home to a number of coffee shops, including the prestigious Blue Bottle, and while there's nothing incredibly great about Cafe La Vie, they do serve decent enough coffee for me to return regularly without breaking the bank.

I've felt it more comfortable to snag a table outside, the more desirable seating choice anyway on a sunny day, but even more so with their small storefront.  There is little space to lounge inside.

On a couple of occasions, there have only been one staff tending to the counter.  It may be an annoyance when all you want is drip coffee and you're stuck waiting while they're prepping a bagel sandwich for a customer ahead of you, but I can imagine it's more pressure on the server to do a one-(wo)man-show to keep the cafe running without any help.  I just make sure to leave with enough time to anticipate that this may be an issue when I arrive--problem solved.  The baristas I've encountered here have all been friendly, and any delays are met with an apology.

Their offerings are standard cafe fare, but also include vegan Alternative Baking Company cookies.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Great organic coffee and pastries at reasonable prices. A little edgy and that's why I like it.
author: Miklos P.

description: The food is great, I abselutely love the egg sandwich BUT what I don't like is this b***h who decided to hang up in my face for lord knows whatever reason. I simply called to ask if I can place an order while I'm at work and she replied "we dont do phone orders our credit card machine is tied up see you soon kbye" & hung up on me like I wasn't nice about the whole situation. If I could slam her face into the cash register for having no customer service skills I would but I'm not violent so ultimately I would that's just how mad I am. If the manager is reading this today is October 22 the time is 7:43 please talk to your rude a$$ cashier & train her on how to deal with a polite customer over the phone. I legit have anger issues and she p!ssed me off. I totally get if it's busy & what not but she could've handled the situation way better! Needless to say I will never return simply because she handled that situation terribly. Love the food though,  super convenient and yummy!
author: nichol c.

description: Low prices, awesome drinks, and they can make a hell of a sandwich, especially for $6
author: Faiz H.

description: Excellent neighborhood joint with good coffee and excellent bagels with hummus/cucumbers.
author: April M.

description: Great vibe, great staff, great coffee and tea. I love coming in for something on the go and I am always pleased. I generally stay away from the breakfast sandwiches because I've not been impressed, but the regular sandwiches are pretty good.
author: Alexa L.

description: Just fell in love with this spot. Enjoying hot cocoa next to a huge open window--sunshine, fresh air, music, birds chirping :) Warm and friendly service creates a welcoming atmosphere.
author: Cindy L.

description: I have been there many times and the baristas continue to be awesome, nice and attentive. The place is actually really nice and the servers very nice, attentive and clean. The place has reasonable prices, it's nice and warm environment. The only thing is they sometimes have some crazy walk-in but that's not their fault, they are just so nice to everyone. They have simple items on their menu, but they're made with attentiveness.
author: Juan C.

description:
If Momi Toby's is the anti-laptop cafe in Hayes Valley, Cafe La Vie is definitely its antithesis, with young hipsters huddled over their machines and not a conversation to break the silence. If the two cafes were characters in a comic book, Momi Toby's would be an ethereal character with a penchant for long, lazy conversations, staying out way too late and smoking too many cigarettes, and Cafe La Vie its arch nemesis.

Still, for how modern it is and laptop-obsessed, Cafe La Vie manages to have some soul. The folks behind the counter are always characters, serving up a side of sparkling indie pop with your Mr. Espresso. Today I heard Wheezer, Vampire Weekend, AC Newman and TV on the Radio all in one sitting. The espresso machine is super retro and they have a lovely selection of teas and healthy juices to drink, and even some simple soups and sandwiches.

The fire place in the back is pretty cozy, but most notably, it can thaw writer's block! This place wins my "Best place to work in the Valley" award.
author: Nicole G.

description: Came here last minute just to get my girl some hot tea. Ended up getting her a veggie croissant, and myself a deli sandwich. Both were really good, and the service was also welcoming and put a smilw on my face. Def a good place to stop by for a quick bite or some coffee!
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Cozy place to hang out on a rainy day. Warm and inviting, Cafe La Vie makes one want to come back for more. 

This is how a coffee shop should be. Intimate and comfortable. What else can you ask for? Cafe La Vie is more personal than just writing your name on cup. It has actual ceramic cups and real people serving you your coffee. I love the feel of this place and would come back anytime I'm around the area! Check it out!
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is awesome.

the service here is prety awesome. I meet my friend friend here whatever sound good, and also met the owner of the place omg they're hella kool.

pretty chill place, found out it a garage place and I would definitely come here again.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
Cafe La Vie is adorable (if small, but I consider that a plus). The baristas are the sweetest in the City, I swear. Both the espresso and the drip have always been excellent. Another one of my "coffee spots with no pretense" places to hang. 

There's also this kinda funny 1980s decor vibe. It's cute.
author: Holden P.

description:
-CUTE and COZY (but not hella small, high ceilings and lovely warm tones abound this place)
-accessible wifi
-barista take their time to make your coffee (care!)
-doggie friendly (they have a jar of free dog treats for your pet)
-featured art work
-seats outside and benches
-lots of regulars


LOVE LOVE LOVE this CAFE!

=8)
author: Grace M.

description:
When I was new to working in the area, I came here for a pre-training bagel and coffee. The tall guy with long hair working behind the counter was super friendly, and seemed to know most of the customers in the cafe, always a plus.  At around 3.50, you get a bagel piled with veggies, cheese, egg and your choice of meat. The coffee was also delicious and cheap (around 1.75 for flavorful drip). I left in shock and awe of how full I was, how tasty my coffee was, and how i spent, after tipping a few bucks, around 6 bucks. Amazing and unheard of in this city.

My only complaint was that it was really busy and he was the only one behind the counter, so it took a while for me to order. If word gets out that you can get cheap eats and good coffee at this place, they might need to hire some more people...
author: Laurel T.

description:
Bless this place! It stands up against the hordes of Starbucks and Peet's taking over S.F.! 

The service is sincere. My lovely barista, Eileen, knows what I really want, and have never gotten my drink wrong here. The cup sizes are so generous! Mmh - Caramel hot steamed milk. :) 

*I noticed this place is a garage, if you observe carefully.
author: Jan P.

description:
This place is pretty good but the ambiance is not very good.  It's great for take out if you live in the area but the interior probably wouldn't impress your afternoon date.  I guess on that same point, it's inexpensive and definitely less pretentious than most of the other cafes in the Hayes Valley area.  It sort of feels like it stumbled over from the lower haight after a late night binge drinking ;).

Ambiance aside, the veggie bagel was piled high with cream cheese, tomato, avocado, and cucumber.  - It was delicious!

The service was prompt and the barista/food-preparer/cashier was nice and friendly.  

My palate isn't the most refined for coffee but I thought the coffee was quite good :)

Summary:

Veggie bagel w/ Cream Cheese - 5
Drip Coffee - 5
Service - 5
Albiance - 3

Veggie Bagel w/ cream cheese and avocado and a small coffee - $5.20

Definitely recommended for coffee and a bagel to go...
author: Joseph H.

description: I've kept trying this place, hoping each time a decent cup of coffee was made. Nope!
author: Yuri V.

description: Small quiet cafe to work. Good for weekday afternoon. Free wifi with purchase. Friendly laid-back server.
author: L W.

description: I was here a month ago, it took a very long time to get a cup of coffee, but I wasn't in a rush so I waited the twenty minutes while the barista made sandwiches and then my coffee.  I was there a half hour total waiting for a cup of drip coffee.  Tried to get a cup of coffee today, waited in line for 15 minutes behind two people, and then was told I had to wait longer as the one person working made food.  All I wanted was one medium cup of drip coffee.  I left.  If it is so busy that somebody has to wait more than 15 minutes just to get to the counter to place an order, and then you tell that person to wait longer, then that may be a sign you are understaffed.  I won't go back here, despite how nice the barista is and it's obviously a local favorite.  A cup of coffee for $1.80 isn't worth 30 minutes of my day when blue bottle and other coffee places are a stone's throw away.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I've 5'2 and whenever I want to pretend I'm vertically blessed, I go to Cafe La Vie. Their chairs and tables are so low to the ground and out of proportion, they're practically unusable. If this is their way of encouraging people not to linger with their laptops, it's working wonders. 

Coffee's just okay and the baristas are always pleasant.
author: Amy Z.

description: It's small inside. Free wifi with purchase. Good to work if you don't mind a cozy space. The coffee was good, but as other reviewers point out, the space is pretty dark and closed in. I found the barista friendly.
author: Rae B.

description: I just love this cofe shop! Very funky and comfy! Very cozy environment and very quiet place if you feel like reading or surfing web.
author: Aglaya S.

description:
This place is chill and the espresso is tops. The Asian girl is a sweetheart and always talks to me. Something is weird and wrong with the blonde chick... like she's got an attitude. Anyways that doesn't effect the espresso or yummy salmon bagel.

To reference the person who couldn't study at a cafe: DUH it's a cafe, not a library. People are suppose to socialize at cafes not use it like a studyhall. RETARD.
author: K K.

description: The staff here is great! Coffee is delicious and I always find a good bite to eat that I love. Keep on keeping on Café La Vie.
author: m m.

description:
What a lovely little cafe!

I discovered Cafe La Vie when I got an offer to hang my artwork.  I spent 4 hours hanging paintings and causing a bit of a disturbance, but everyone was so nice and understanding.  After that I stayed and drank their delicious coffee and ended up chatting with some of the other people there.

What more do you want in a cafe?  Great coffee, kind people, cute location in Hayes Valley.
author: Kate J.

description:
This cafe is pretty dirty. Every time I've been here in the afternoon, nobody has wiped down the tables. 

The service is straight forward and quick. The coffee is okay. It's hard to compare with Blue Bottle close by.

If the space was cleaner, I wouldn't hesitate to stop by. Please clean!
author: Jim B.

description:
How often do you get free coffee from a coffee shop that is not even open? Probably never unless you are at Cafe La Vie!

My bf and I were at dinner when he started to have an allergic reaction to the food. Apparently on of the best aids for an allergic reaction is coffee... so... we rushed over to Cafe La Vie which we'd passed before dinner. When we walked in, the incredibly nice barristas apologized that they were already closed. I asked, "do you by chance still have any coffee?" and they responded, "sure, you can have some!" and started to pour it in a huge cup. I explained that we were SO appreciative and that the bf actually needed it to help with his allergies. He then requested milk (which I teased would not help his allergies) and they whipped it out willingly. So, we left with a delicious, warm, large, free cup of coffee and a healthier boy!
author: Meghan P.

description: Love this spot -- might be my new go to for a breakfast sandwich. Wasn't the greatest sandwich I've ever eaten but I love the service, the price, and the place's vibe. Good stuff.
author: Michael M.

description: Absolutely adorable little neighborhood cafe.  The best part (other than the delicious coffee and breakfast sammiches) is people watching folks coming in and out of the place - usually with their tiny dogs!   The staff is fantastic, too.  Really unbelievably friendly - and completely entertaining.  David is the bomb.   Thanks, Cafe La Vie!   Would honestly consider moving to San Fran just for you.  :)
author: Stacey M.

description:
Wifi? Check. Great coffee? Check. Lox & bagels for the half-jew inside of me? Check. And possibly the nicest dude ever manning the shop, pouring coffee, and making bagels. 

Place was totally unexpected, had a client meeting, showed up an hour early to get some work done, and was so impressed by the hospitality and the vibe that I'm starting the day giving my man a 5 star Yelp review instead of answering client emails. 

Table layout - tight but friendly, and high bar chairs are available for those who prefer it. The decor is very cool but not pretentious, and the light / fan / shelf over the coffee bar adds a little something too. There were even little dogs walking around inside. 

Only drawback - no music was on when I got there, and it would have been nice to get a little Soundgarden with my coffee. But dude is only one man, and he had his hands full creating a rad morning for his customers, of which there were plenty. 

Well done Cafe La Vie. If I ever find myself in Hayes Valley needing coffee, I'm coming to your front door every time.
author: Mike B.

description:
I feel like I have to add my two cents to this conversation.  Yes, it's cute, it has high ceilings and an incredibly cool fireplace in a picture frame.  The coffee is good, and the wifi works fine.  If you want to come and go, or be here less than 15 minutes, it is probably great.

However, the chairs are miserable, and the tables are weird and tiny.   If you want to be here more than 15 minutes your back will hurt and you will keep sliding around in the awkward where-the-hell-did-they-come-from chairs.  I mean I have a really small butt and I do yoga everyday, meaning I of all people should I be ok in these chairs, but they really are a torture that sneaks up on you.
author: Dana M.

description:
I'm a regular and feel lucky to have this place in the neighborhood.  The espresso is good.  The bagels too.  The wifi stays connected, if that matters to you.

I laugh at some of the reviews here complaining about service!  Everyone that works here is nice.  The baristas have character (one in particular) and that is a Good Thing.  An espresso in the morning is great, served with a sense of humor, even better.

Oh, and somehow the music is always good, too.
author: Dave C.

description: Great little place with super friendly staff. And the breakfast sandwiches were awesome.
author: Courtney H.

description: I was craving hot chocolate since Im pregnant and dont want to drink coffee and I wanted to be warmed up. This place was pretty good and it was really cheap! I would come back :) They have in and outdoor seating and they have a water bowl out for doggies to drink from. So cute.
author: Rachel W.

description:
i love this little cafe, adjacent to the little strip of green in hayes valley.  sure blue bottle has good coffee, but i don't like to wait in line and there is no place to sit there, so i happened to find la vie while trying to find a place that i could go to with my dog.  La Vie has great Chai - if you like spicy chai rather than too sweet Oregon Chai, this is the place for you.  they put in a little bit of apple juice to sweeten it naturally.  and it's HOT HOT HOT!  i find that when i get blue bottle coffee that it's luke warm at best, even when i ask them to make it hot.  

AND they are muy dog friendly - dogs can even come INSIDE *gasp*, there is a jar of dog treats and there is also seating outside if you'd prefer fido not bother the patrons busily tapping away on their laptops inside.  oh yah, and they are very nice to people too.

they also feature local artists on their walls which is so cool in my book.

they have limited food options, but enough to calm a growling stomach (scones, bagels, muffins).  and they always play great music and have free wifi.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
The ideal neighborhood cafe. Unpretentious, reasonably priced, friendly staff. Warm, inviting atmosphere, especially on nice days when they open the garage doors. I get a lot of work done here.

If you're into snooty-pants coffee, go to Ritual or Blue Bottle just down the block.

Thanks, Cafe La Vie :)
author: Obhi H.

description:
I got a good pastry and coffee here (and they had a deal). I also really like the iced tea. 

This place has cool environment! The front opens up and it's nice when there's a breeze. There's also outdoor seating.
author: Julia L.

description:
One of the best parts about being nestled in Hayes Valley is having this place just down the street. Every time I go in there, I'm greeted with a warm and bright welcome. Their breakfast sandwiches are amazing and seem to be the perfect cure after a hard night of drinking. I really need to start popping in there more often. 

cheers to Cafe La Vie
author: Philip S.

description:
This is sadly not a place to study :(

The boyfriend and I came here to try to get some studying done after brunch at Stacks. The wifi here does not work if my life depended on it and the tables are tiny, tiny glass tables fit for a small child. We were literally bent over our knees on our stools attempting to share the tiny round table. The cafe itself is small and only fits about 4-5 tables max. There are also 2 small tables outside, which are better suited for studying if the weather permits.

The boyfriend ordered some iced tea and I requested an iced chai latte. Both weren't sweet and not memorable at all.

They do have a cool garage doorway window though.
author: Lily Z.

description: I was wandering around Hayes Valley trying to find a cute little cafe to do some studying, and i found it! I dont have much to base my review on since I only got a hot chocolate but I was in love with the decor! It is a really small and cozy cafe with only about 5-6 tables but I sat at a corner one with cute cushions and it was great :) Nice music playing in the background, relatively quiet and comforting lighting. My boyfriend ordered a large hot chocolate and we both enjoyed it. I definitely do wanna come back and try their coffee and other things but great find!
author: Isabella L.

description:
I've been coming here for over a year now and I've had consistently good coffee, good service and a quiet, comfortable free wifi spot to get some work done.

I remember once when I was searching for breakfast in Hayes Valley.  Stupidly, I went to the crepe house.  Instead I should have come here for a properly toasted bagel with cream cheese.  Mmm!
author: Jay M.

description:
My favorite coffee shop I have ever experienced! The baristas Jessica and Juliana are superstars! They are the most friendly people I have ever met at a coffee shop. 

Cafe La Vie is not just about coffee, its about community and love! Everyone that goes there is super happy!  :)

The coffee, lattes, and bagels are amazing!
author: Aaron G.

description: Don't miss out on Cafe la Vie! I'm convinced it gets overshadowed by the other cafes and restaurants in the Hayes Valley area, but all you have to do is walk a few more steps down Octavia and there it is! Their coffee is good, their sandwiches are good, but their bagels are great. Especially their lox bagels! If you like lox, try it here. They pile it on with cream cheese, onions, and capers, and will even add avocado or tomato if you want (but I don't know why you would... Why mess with a good thing?) the seating always seems to be filled, but this place is super close to the park, and they have a few tables and chairs outdoors as well. The employees also seem to know most of the customers that come in. All around friendly place with classic breakfast foods.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I love this cozy cute little cafe hidden in the Hayes Valley!  This is my second time visiting and I am loving it.  I strongly recommend this cafe for its superior customer service, quiet ambiance and delicious lox bagel!  This is a perfect cafe to visit for a lazy sunny afternoon when you need to get some work done but dont want to be at home or office.  The wifi makes it easy to get some work done on the computers.  The only downside I have noticed is the limited space.  there are only 3 high tables and unless you feel comfortable sharing with others (people usually are very willing to share though if you ask,) you will probably have to wait for awhile at one of the two lower tables.
